questiontext.text:
A researcher conducts a single regression analysis with “Income” (net monthly salary, in euros) as the dependent variable and variable “Age” (age in years) as the independent variable.

It calculates a 95% confidence interval (confidence interval) of the slope. This interval turns out to be [-0.02; 0.06].

What can we conclude from this, if we test two-sidedly whether Age has a significant influence on Income? We use here a significance level of 5% (α = 0.05).

answer.text: Age does well significantly affect Income, because the interval does well contain the number 0.
Age has no significant influence on Income, because the interval contains well the number 0.05.
Age does have a significant influence on Income, because the interval does well contain the number 0.05.
Age has no significant influence on Income, because the interval contains well the number 0.
